content.description: Sit start on a small two finger edge for the right hand and a high jug left hand gaston. Pull on with some obvious footholds and power up into the awkward incut undercling. From here figure out how to reach up lefty to a jug and before following large rail features and finishing fairly high above a blocky slanted landing.
content.protection: 1 or 2 pads for the crux intro.
content.location: The middle of the face. This line starts on a few rocks that may have sheered off the boulder at one point.

content.description: Stand start at the left side of the wall. Step up the slab below and start crossed with left hand on a sidepull and a right hand slightly lower. Pull onto the wall using a large foot and make a powerful move up to a large hold. Continue up and left then reach far back right to a large horn before topping out over the flat lip.
content.protection: A few pads. Maybe a spotter. There is a rock behind that might enjoy hitting a few heads from a violent fall.
content.location: This problem is located on the left side of the face below a large dihedral feature. The rock slab at the bottom is used to stand on before pulling onto the wall.

content.description: This is the first large face visible about 15-20 yards off the road and up the hill. It has blocky incuts and juggy features on decent rock quality. This boulder has a roadside face that is around 40-45 degrees overhanging.
